meanings.definition: The act of blocking or closing off a passage or opening.
meanings.sent1: The obturation of the tunnel prevented anyone from entering.
meanings.sent2: The obturation of the dam ensured no water could pass through.
meanings.sent3: The obturation of the cookie jar kept the treats safe from sneaky hands.
meanings.sent4: Her laughter was like an obturation, sealing off any sadness in the room.
meanings.sent5: The obturation of the door with a heavy lock made it impossible to open.

meanings.definition: The process of filling a cavity or space with a material to prevent leakage or seepage.
meanings.sent1: Dental obturation is necessary to protect the tooth from decay.
meanings.sent2: The obturation of cracks in the wall stopped the water from leaking in.
meanings.sent3: The obturation of the balloon with glitter made it sparkle from the inside.
meanings.sent4: Her smile was an obturation of joy that radiated from within.
meanings.sent5: The obturation of the bottle with a cork preserved the freshness of the wine.
